intro: Rhinanthus nemorivagans, commonly known as the common yellow toadflax, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its yellow, tubular flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in open woodlands, meadows, and grasslands, often in shaded or semi-shaded areas. It has opposite, ovate leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous small seeds. Rhinanthus nemorivagans is known for its role in supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
